message: Hey guys, this is the use-case model that i came up with, feel free for suggestions
Also i have committed to git hub with a draft of risk assessment document
I'm finding hard to come up with risks associated with the system in terms of coding, may be coz i'm not much of a coder, so feel free to suggest risk associate to those

Cool.  I've got the Project Plan started.  Here's a rough draft, based on the submittables.

I'll be off all day tomorrow, so I can polish it up

I'd be interesting in seeing Murali's input on it, but I think it's good for submission as is for a preliminary Use case model.
thanks, ya since it's the initial use-case model, it should not be entirely complete but i would want to make sure that it's atleast correct :)
As well as, this is what i could come up so far as the risk assessment

Risk Assessment

Performing a risk assessment is an important step in being prepared for potential problems that can occur during the development of the project. During the risk assessment, if a potential risk is identified, a solution or plan of action should be developed. The following is a list of potential project risks. Each risk that receives a high score should have a corresponding plan for management and control of the risk. The criteria that are applied when selecting the appropriate risk level are as follows:

Low - Very unlikely that this will occur during the development of the project

Medium - There is a 50 - 50 chance that this will occur during the development of the project

High - Very likely that this will occur during the development of the project


1. The hardware or software chosen to do the project can’t handle the workload required to complete the project.

Low		Medium		High


2. The cost of labor, support costs and other charges aren’t within the budget and will it increase year to year.

Low		Medium		High


3. We do not have enough resources / manpower and the project team member aren’t in place when required.

Low		Medium		High


4. The requirements has not been gathered and defined adequately.

Low		Medium		High


5. The requirements is continually changing.

Low		Medium		High


6. The project will not be completed on time.

Low		Medium		High


7. There is no correct platform for testing and modeling.

Low		Medium		High


8. The system require continuos maintenance and debugging.

Low		Medium		High


9. The project has not been planned carefully and do not have a vision document.

Low		Medium		High


10. We do not have experienced team members and the work has not been divided correctly.

Low		Medium		High


11. The user interface is not correct, clear and easy to use.

Low		Medium		High


12.  The system is affected when more customers are added as members.

Low		Medium		High


13.  The compilers or code generators available are not  appropriate for the system to be built.

Low		Medium		High


14. The testing tools available are not appropriate for the system to be built?

Low		Medium		High


15. The formal technical reviews of test procedures and test cases are not conducted regularly.

Low		Medium		High


16. A delay in one deliverable causes cascading delays in the completion of the project.

Low		Medium		High


17.  The compilers or code generators available are not appropriate for the product to be built.

Low		Medium		High

18. The software configuration management tools are not available.

Low		Medium		High

19. The End-user input is not solicited, causing ultimate failure of the product and  to meet user expectations.

Low		Medium		High


20. The requirements demand the use of new analysis, design, or testing methods and  use of unconventional software development methods?

Low		Medium		High
And of course, i would also suggest a possible resolution when we have a risk, so a way out of the risk of each of these
sorry guys (I wasn't feeling well earlier and fell asleep and bam, 6 PM came around). Let me catch up on what's been typed above.

The Vision Document was surprising kind of difficult to put together, mainly because I didn't really have a clear idea of what it needed to look I guess so I was looking at quite a few templates, before deciding on a simpler one, but still am not super happy with the content of it...I feel like it's too simple.\nhttps://github.com/gt-ud-softeng/cs6300-summer-team22/tree/Deliverable1/6300Sum14Project2/Deliverable1

I was more thinking, not pick an answer but have a resolution in case the risk was high, but i am open to suggestions on that
I'm guessing in our next meeting we'll pick which is mmost likely (low/med/high) and come up with contingency cases/discussions for med/high/
That sounds good Tony, we could do that..
ok, so that meeting would be next week as part of Deliverable 2?
right. we point out what the possibilities are and likelihoods for 1, then contingency for 2

cool.
And how about the use-case model, would that be sufficient for initial use?

ok I was just going to suggest that I could go ahead and help rename the RiskAssessment file to RiskAssessment.md and then we can go ahead and make the initial answer marking for each question as a team (and mark that in bold). I'm thinking at the end of each of the sentences we can put what we think the risk is in parentheses.

For example:
1. The hardware or software chosen to do the project can't handle the workload required to complete the project.(Low Risk)
That sounds goo @OmarRamos , do we want to put a solution if incase the risk was high?

we can leave that part till next week if we want to (that's what I think Tony was mentioning above...just identifying the risk levels this week and then putting in plans for anything that happens to be at a higher risk level)
right.
sounds great
and Murali seems to know where he's going on the prototype front
Question, how can i upload the use-case model (as pdf) to the git hub?

@ChandraSapkota One quick thing on the use case model...the Owner should also be able to Register / Update a Customer record. I really haven't created any of those Use Case Models before though so it's a little unclear to me as to how it should look but so far I think it looks pretty good
Thats a good point Omar, may be instead of the line from customer to register, we have a line from owner to the register, that should solve the isssue, good point :)
Or i'll add a new case saying change customer info and include all the parameter used while registering

I think it might be ok to have both the Customer and the Owner pointing to the Register option (I could see maybe at the cart where the Owner/Employee might pass the phone/tablet over to the customer to have them fill out their own info, and the other situation where they might type it in for them)

In case of the scenario where the owner needs to change only one info i.e. lets say the phone number, pointing to the register may not work, so i have added another class saying change info as below, let me know what you think
In this case he has the choice of choosing only one or all if necessary
ok, that makes sense
overall, it looks like we're doing pretty good for this week (for some reason it seemed like there was more we needed to do this week the other day)
Ya for the first deliverable we should be ok, next time when we meet we do need to identify the risk on each of those points, and we should be good

Sure, no problem. The main thing I think would be to go ahead and checkout a fresh clone of the repository:
git clone https://github.com/gt-ud-softeng/cs6300-summer-team22
git checkout Deliverable1

Since you would be starting at that point you should have the latest copy at that time. However, afterwards, there's always the chance someone might have committed something so you may want to pull down any changes first before doing anything else:
git pull origin Deliverable1

place your file in the Deliverable1 in-progress folder (the ArgoUML one)
then:
git add 6300Sum14Project2/Deliverable1/in-progress/YourFileName
git commit -m "Adding the Use Case Model Original"

After the commit then:
git push origin Deliverable1
Excellent, talk to everyone on Saturday :-)
Thanks Omar, talk to you guys on saturday
